DOC.detailed_description: In single-blind , three-arm sham-controlled study , ass whether transcranial direct current stimulation ( tDCS ; safe non-invasive method modulating activity specific brain region ) apply orbitofrontal cortex ( OFC ) able modulate decision-making impulse control healthy volunteer . We hypothesize tDCS apply OFC , comparison sham tDCS , significantly enhance decision-making impulse control . For study enroll 45 healthy individual age 18-60 year . These individual assess battery computerized task well clinician-administered self-reported questionnaire depression anxiety . Assessments carry single 30-minute tDCS session .
